mainHero.title: Occupational Therapy
mainHero.subtitle: for young and old
mainHero.additionalText: Through activities to independence in everyday life.
mainHero.description: Occupational therapy is a client-centered profession focused on promoting health and well-being through activities. The primary goal of occupational therapy is to enable people to participate in everyday activities.
mainHero.ctaText: Click for a 10 min free consultation

aboutMePage.paragraph:
Under the slogan RUA, I am Tina Zadravec, Master of Art Therapy and a graduate occupational therapist. With decades of experience, I connect knowledge from university studies and additional professional training to ensure an individualized approach and treatment for each person.

I co-create moments when users say: "I haven’t had so many ideas and information about the possibilities that exist in a long time!"
We help people rebuild the belief that they, too, can perform everyday activities that have long seemed impossible.
 
Within occupational therapy, we work in the field of [re]habilitation of individuals with neurological and musculoskeletal difficulties, as well as challenges in mental health. We value knowledge and wisdom and thoughtfully introduce new approaches and therapeutic tools into our work. We also collaborate with professionals from abroad.
We are active members of the Chamber of Occupational Therapists of Slovenia and the Slovenian Association of Art Therapists.

items.title: Occupational therapy for children and adolescents
items.description: Neuro-developmental treatment helps children develop fine motor, social, motor, cognitive, and emotional-social skills they need for play and everyday life.

items.title: Occupational therapy for older adults
items.description: Healthcare professionals - OTs help individuals who have experienced central nervous system disease or musculoskeletal system injuries. We are involved in cognitive and psychosocial rehabilitation and assistance with neurodegenerative disease.

elderlyHero.subtitle: for older adults
elderlyHero.description:
Occupational therapy is a healthcare profession, and an occupational therapist is a healthcare professional who encourages individuals to engage in meaningful everyday activities. Within occupational therapy, we focus on improving or maintaining health in the areas of bodily functions and structures, as well as mental health.

Our shared goals are to carry out activities that promote health, well-being, and the most successful performance of prioritized activities. As an occupational therapist, I am also here to guide you through the components needed to perform activities in the areas of basic daily living — such as independent washing, dressing, and eating.

We will also look at participation in broader daily activities, assess environmental risk factors, work on fall prevention, and provide advice on adapting the home for greater safety. With the individual, we will discuss the use of orthotic and medical-technical aids, and with family members, we will talk about supportive technology that can help the person maintain independence.
elderlyHero.videoAlt: Video presentation of occupational therapy for older adults

features.title: Don't miss ...
features.subtitle: Benefits of occupational therapy
features.description: Occupational therapy brings many benefits to your health and quality of life. With an individually tailored approach, we help you achieve greater independence in everyday activities, improve physical and mental well-being, and actively participate in society. Discover the key benefits that occupational therapy can bring to your life.

items.name: Art therapy support
items.description: Art therapy guides a person through the process of expression and creation. Through music, theater/drama, or visual art therapy approaches, it encourages self-expression, physical and mental well-being, and personal growth. Our focus is on the experience itself, not the final product.

items.name: Neuromuscular taping
items.description: A technique that influences the musculoskeletal, vascular, lymphatic, and neurological systems. It uses (de)compressive stimuli by applying a self-adhesive elastic tape to support the body’s natural healing.

items.name: Occupational therapy with Montessori elements
items.description: When working with people with dementia, it is essential to see the person beyond the diagnosis. Rather than focusing on limitations, we seek their abilities, interests, and unique life stories. Respecting their background, culture, and needs helps create an environment that fosters independence and meaningful engagement. The Montessori approach to dementia, disability, and aging is based on four key principles that strengthen self-esteem, enable choice, and encourage contribution to the community.

items.name: Bobath concept
items.description: A therapeutic approach to the (re)habilitation of neurological conditions, focused on the quality of movement and activity performance. The emphasis is on transferring learned skills into everyday activities and occupations.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.messagePlaceholder:
Hello,

I/we would like more information about your occupational therapy services and possible treatment options. Please provide details regarding available appointments and the fee for therapy / sessions.

Thank you!

Kind regards.
contact.success: Thank you! Your message has been sent.

odrasliFor.header: Occupational therapy is for those, who:
list: Are recovering from musculoskeletal injuries or surgeries (e.g. hip, shoulder or arm fractures) and want to regain or maintain muscle function.
Are facing central nervous system injuries (e.g. stroke, cerebral palsy, spinal cord or brain injuries, meningitis, ALS).
Are experiencing movement challenges due to age-related changes (e.g. reduced strength, mobility and balance).
Live with chronic illnesses (e.g. Parkinson's disease, multiple sclerosis, Huntington's disease).
Experience cognitive changes (e.g. dementia, Alzheimer's disease, mild cognitive impairment), where the goal is to maintain daily independence.
Have difficulties with daily activities (e.g. dressing, personal hygiene, cooking and shopping).
Need adjustments to their home environment (e.g. aids, safe room layouts to prevent falls, bathroom modifications).
Want to use medical-technical aids but are looking for ideas on how to use them.
Live in a home environment and want to maintain as much independence and quality of life as possible.
Face social and psychological challenges (loneliness, loss of motivation or depression), where occupational therapy can offer meaningful activities and support.

cenikPage.title: Price list
cenikPage.note: *Therapies are performed at the client's home. For locations outside our regular operation area, travel costs are charged according to the official mileage rate.
